--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin Green <cgreen@d...> wrote:
> Kenneth Stanley wrote:
> 

> 
> >(On a side note, for anyone wondering, yes this does mean there is
> >a version of NEAT that can evolve Hebbian networks with plastic
> >synapses, but I haven't released it yet.) 
> >  
> >
> Any ideas on when it might be released? any time soon?
> 

Sorry I didn't get to this question for a while, I kind of got lost in
the numerous threads.  It's too bad this newsgroup isn't threaded.  I
am thinking to release it sometime in early to mid 2004, but I'm not
sure exactly.  I may speed it up if there is specific demand, i.e.
someone has some specific experiment they are serious about doing with
it.  But otherwise I want to clean up the code a bit.  The thing is
that my latest NEAT source code has a lot of baggage (i.e. extra
experiments, neural network variations, etc..) that's gotten attached
over the years, and I think that might make it difficult to deal with
for people not familiar with the core parts of the system.

ken
